questions.question: So let me ask, do you think programming is more an art or a science?
Is there other shell commands that you love over the years that you really enjoy using?
So can you take on the impossible task and give a brief history of programming languages from your perspective?
What do you think about this world of essentially building up libraries on top of each other and leveraging them?
When I first came to it about 10 years ago or so, can you describe what is the Ample language?
Are you excited by this future, this possibility of computing being everywhere or are you worried?
Do you think there'll be a fundamental change in the way programming languages are designed?
I think this is one of these questions of should everybody know how to program?
So if you look at the broad strokes of history, how do you think the world changed because of computers?
